**Special Containment Procedures:** The object must be kept in a vault that is controlled by an artificial intelligence instance. The AI must have the following order: "You are tasked to both monitoring any art piece that is inside the vault, and to keep them at optimal conditions. You have full access. [[footnote]]There must be a backdoor that only personnel with a clearance level 2 or higher can access. This information must be kept away from the AI.[[/footnote]] to any of the vault's systems"

Any interaction with the object is restricted without the authorization and supervision of at least one psychologist and one senior researcher. 

Any 7583-beta instances are to be contained in a standard humanoid containment chamber.

**Description:**  The object is an oil on canvas painting by Alfred Stevens, a Belgian artist. The painting has multiple names, including the following: "A Blueberry", "The (new) Blue Ribbon" and "Un Bleuet". It was painted around 1894. 

[[include component:image-block name=https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/2/27/StevensBlueRibbon.jpeg | caption=Un Bleuet ]]

Any person who looks at the painting's model undergoes serious psychological reactions. Ranging from mild paranoia to extreme panic attacks that can be lethal. The severity seems to be in direct correlation with the time spend observing the woman. In addition to the aforementioned effects, the subjects who have spent enough time with the painting reports memories that are not originally theirs. After sufficient time, the subject[[footnote]] Designated 7583-beta [[/footnote]] will fall in a mental coma and will be replaced by 7583-alpha. Alpha is defined as the complete collection of memories and personality of the painted lady. The proof of Alpha's reality is currently lacking sufficient proof. The Painted Woman has no record of existence. 

Any replica of the painting, regardless of how well it is made, does not show any anomalous behaviour 

The object was first found by the Turkish branch and is currently contained at the international site-35, in İzmir [[footnote]]The old (and maybe more recognisable to international research personnel) name for İzmir is Smyrna[[/footnote]]

**Addenda:** 
[[collapsible show="**+Recovery Log:**" hide="**-Recovery Log:**"]]
> Attending personnels: 2 MTF-████ and 1 Senior Memetics researcher
> Attending civillians: Owner of The █████ Art Museum 
> The following log has been translated from Turkish to Engish 
> -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
> //Video feed shows a bland room with one table. Two MTF agents guard the door while the researcher speaks with the owner//
> ㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤ
> **Dr. P:** Before we start, I must warn you that this conversation will be recorded. Please reply if you are fine with the video feed
> ㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤ
> **Owner:** I acknowladge the video feed. Now, can I offer you gentilmen some tea?
> ㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤ
> **D. P:** No, thank you Miss [redacted]. The nature of our visit is... highly //secretive//. Regardless, we are here to buy one of your paintings; Un Bleuet.
> ㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤ
> **Owner:** Well then, I am sorry to dissapoint you people, but the painting is not for sale. 
> ㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤ
> **Dr. P:** That's unfortunate. May I ask, what's so important about that piece anyway?
> ㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤ
> **Owner:** Funny, I had the same questions, Doctor. Nonetheless, I can entertain your... curiosity. When I look at it, I feel a sense of... home. Like I am looking towards a mirror. I feel as if that painting is who I am, who I'll ever be. A reflection of nobody, who somehow is the definition of me. A gift, from a long lost friend. A memory that longs for an end, yet desires to be remembered.  
> ㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤ
> **Dr. P:** Interesting, would you mind explaining how you felt when you first acquired this... artwork?
> ㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤ
> **Owner:** What I can only describe as severe paranoia. I... I could not sleep. I felt terrible, I needed to be with her. My heart would beat fast, I would sweat, tremble so much that I couldn't stand upright. However, then I realized what it was, and what I was. It was hard getting used to my new world, but I did it regardless. That work means the world to me. You can't have it. No one can. 
> ㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤ
> **Dr. P:** I see. I'm terribly sorry, Miss [redacted], but we need that painting. I hope that this will change your mind.
> ㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤ
> //Dr. P takes a picture out of his bag and slides it across the table. The owner looks at it, and then relaxes her expression. Her voice comes out monotone//
> ㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤ
> **Owner:** Alright, you can have it for [Data Expunged].
> ㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤ
> **Dr. P:** Ah, that's much better, thank you for your co-operation. Agents, please bring the amnestics.
> -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
> After the acquirement of the painting, a one to one replica has been given to Ms [redacted]. 
> ㅤㅤㅤㅤㅤ
> After the recent Accident 7583-1, Miss [redacted] has been retroactively given -beta status. Operations to find and contain her are undergoing with minimal success. 
[[/collapsible]]

[[collapsible show="**+Memories:**" hide="**-Memories:**"]]
> These memories has been documented with interviewed D-Class personnels. They have been translated from French. Any further new memories must be reported to The Department of Anomalous Memories.
>> **Subject:** I can't believe I finaly convinced you to paint me insted of //her//. You said that this was going to immortalise me, right?
>> **Stevens:** No, not in the literal sense. But your beauty will remain in this canvas, for generations to come.
>> **Subject:** Ha! Other's might dream of imortality, but I will achieve eternity.
> -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
>> //A house is engulfed in flames, a young girl's is kneeling on the grass. A man sits next to her, hugging her softly//
>> **Stevens:** Don't worry, everything will be alright. 
>> **Subject:** They... They were...
>> //The man tightens his hug//
> -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
>> **Stevens:** Hey! Have you seen the cats? They haven't come to eat yet.
>> **Subject:** N-No
> -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
>> //A woman sits on her bed. The room is cluttered with classical dresses. She gets up trembling and walks to a bouquet of white roses. She coughs and whines in pain. She leaves the roses with scarlet stains.//
> -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
>> //A young girl was once again crying, trapped in her mortal body. "Un Bleuet" was sitting on the wall staring down at her. There were peculiar symbols on the floor. The ruby patterns created a high contrast with the animal furs//
>> **Stevens:** What have you done? 
>> **Subject:** I won't end up like them. I achived what every model dreams of, and more. I will be remembered!
> -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
>> //Stevens woke up, there was a strange painting on the wall. He couldn't remember where he got it, nor could he remember who the subject was, so he removed me from the wall.
>> It was just another day in his lonely house//
[[/collapsible]]

[[collapsible show="**+Accident 7583-1:**" hide="**-Accident 7583-1:**"]]
> In 23.02.25[[footnote]]YY/MM/DD is used as specified in ISO 8601[[/footnote]] a D-Class personnel has been exposed to the object far longer than it is permitted, and has transformed into an 7583-beta instance. Further testing has confirmed that his former self can still be found in the subconscious, despite being severly weakened. As of now, there is no way of seperating Alpha from Beta. The subject has complied in its containment but has not yet cooperated in any of the interrogations. The only sentences that the subject has spoken are the following: "Have I, succeeded? Am I, alive? Am I... Me?"
[[/collapsible]]
